headerSection.heading: The Crash Course about me
headerSection.text: I am a curious and openminded developer with a background in sales and customer service. I enjoy creativity and really love to think outside the box. Throw in a splash of color, cool animations, a touch of playfulness and a pinch of humor and thats what you’ll get from me in a future collaboration.

projects.name: Happy Thoughts
projects.text: This project focus on APIs and React. It is a simple app where you can share your happy thougts together with other users. It was a lot of fun working with this project. The goal was to learn how to follow a design in Figma and build a responsive web app with React that uses an API. For this project i used Postman to test the API, wich was very helpful.

projects.name: ScreamFlix
projects.text: This project focus on APIs, React and React Router. The goal was to learn how to fetch data from an API and display it in a user-friendly way. We also worked with React Router to create a single-page application with multiple routes. I really enjoyed this project since I got to work with a lot of different technologies and tools.

projects.name: Web Accessibility Quiz
projects.text: This project focus on web accessibility. The goal was to learn how to develop inclusive digital experiences that work for everyone, regardless of their functional ability. We worked with semantic HTML, proper use of ARIA attributes, clear color contrast, keyboard navigation, and responsive design.

projects.name: Morbid Gene Official
projects.text: This website is built with HTML, CSS and JavaScript and was one of my very first projects i built.  It’s the official site for the band Morbid Gene. This project is my favourite since i actually had to work with the client's expectations and really cool content.

projects.name: Weather app
projects.text: This weather app was a group project were we worked with API:s from Openweather. We used TypeScript and work with several branches in Git and learned how to solve merge-conflict if there was any. It was really fun and motivating to work together.

projects.name: Recipe Library
projects.text: This project is built with API:s from Spoonacular to dynamically show real recipes. It was a lot of fun working with this project since we were following a finished design in Figma, but with a little personal tweak.

myJourney.heading: My Journey
myJourney.text:
I’ve been a [[creative]] soul for as long as I can remember. What truly drives me is that deep sense of curiosity and the joy I feel when I get to explore, build, and solve. When I’m fully immersed in a challenge  whether it's solving a tricky bug or designing an engaging user experience - I actually find a sense of calm and focus that I absolutely love. [[Tech gives me the perfect mix of creativity and logic.]]
I thrive on digging into the details, being analytical and stubborn when needed, and seeing how every small piece contributes to something greater. Watching an idea grow from scratch into a functional, visual experience - where design, interactivity, and problem-solving meet - is pure magic to me.
With several years of experience in logistics, sales, and customer service, I’ve developed strong problem-solving skills and a deep understanding of how to work efficiently in fast-paced environments. [[This background has also given me a strong user-focused mindset - I always think about how things will feel and function for the end user.]] Now, I’m combining all those strengths in my journey into tech. Whether it’s writing code, creating accessible and responsive web interfaces, or simply learning something new.
